DataElement.preferredName: Image Acquisition Scan Complete Event Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date reported as two digit month, two digit date and four digit year on which the acquisition of the imaging was completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Completion of the acquisition process of a medical image. [Manually_curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process by which an image is acquired or obtained.

Concepts.definition: The process by which an image is acquired or obtained.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pictures of structures inside the body. Scans often used in diagnosing, staging, and monitoring disease include liver scans, bone scans, and computed tomography (CT) or computerized axial tomography (CAT) scans and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans. In liver scanning and bone scanning, radioactive substances that are injected into the bloodstream collect in these organs. A scanner that detects the radiation is used to create pictures. In CT scanning, an x-ray machine linked to a computer is used to produce detailed pictures of organs inside the body. MRI scans use a large magnet connected to a computer to create pictures of areas inside the body.:Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/16/08 - released for use in CDE by UofWash PET study.  3/16/07 - created to support ACRIN Breast CDE curation

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The place in time that any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic  happens.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Time meaning: Like time, date, frequency, occurence,..etc

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.:Event; something that happens at a given place and time.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.
Something that happens at a given place and time.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 11/30/10 removed "Manually_curated" from definition.  7/16/08 - updated to include qualifers used in long name.  released for use in UofWash study.  3/16/07 - created to support the 10 character ACRIN date fields which include the '/'.

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElement.changeDescription: 11/4/12 jc  Add to ACRIN Context Imaging Modality-MRI CSI; remove from caBIG ACRIN CSIs.  12/14/11 added alternate question text for ACRIN. 2/23/09 Added ACRIN Prostate CSI.  2/19/09 Added to CSI and alternate question text for ACRIN Prostate MRI-MRSI. 1/16/09 Added to CSI and alternate question text for ACRIN Renal DCE-MRI. 8/20/08 - Added to ACRIN GYN MRI CSI.  7/16/08 - Released for use in UofWASH PET study.  7/14/08- Updated to support curation of ACRIN GYN CDEs.   3/17/07-Created to support ACRIN Breast CDE development.
